title: Executive Order Regarding the Acquisition of Certain Assets of Emcore Corporation by Hiefo Corporation
summary: This executive order, issued by the President under the Constitution and under the Defense Production Act of 1950, as amended (section 721, 50 U.S.C. 4565), concerns the acquisition of certain assets of Emcore Corporation by Hiefo Corporation. The order includes a Section 1 Findings provision stating that there is credible evidence informing the action and outlines the legal authorities, scope, and directives associated with the acquisition. It establishes the basis for government action under the Defense Production Act and specifies procedures and responsibilities for implementing the order with respect to the transaction and related assets.

title: National Security Presidential Memorandum on 6G Technology Development and International Coordination
summary: This National Security Presidential Memorandum directs multiple federal departments and agencies to coordinate efforts to advance United States leadership in sixth-generation (6G) telecommunications technology. It outlines objectives to accelerate research and development, strengthen supply chain security, establish standards and interoperability, and foster innovation ecosystems. The memorandum also calls for international collaboration with allied nations, alignment of policy and regulatory actions, and measures to protect national security while supporting the secure development and deployment of 6G networks.
